segment.source: Introduced in Windows 10 Mobile, manufacturing mode is a mode of the full operating system that can be used for manufacturing-related tasks, such as component and support testing.
segment.target: Introduced in Windows 10 Mobile, manufacturing mode is a mode of the full operating system that can be used for manufacturing-related tasks, such as component and support testing.

segment.source: Manufacturing Mode
segment.target: Manufacturing Mode

segment.source: Manufacturing Mode
segment.target: Manufacturing Mode

segment.source: Introduced in Windows 10 Mobile, manufacturing mode is a mode of the full operating system that can be used for manufacturing-related tasks, such as component and support testing.
segment.target: Introduced in Windows 10 Mobile, manufacturing mode is a mode of the full operating system that can be used for manufacturing-related tasks, such as component and support testing.

segment.source: In Windows Phone 8.1, you had to flash the Microsoft Manufacturing Operating System (MMOS) to do manufacturing tests and processes, such as test hardware, blow fuses, and provision security keys.
segment.target: In Windows Phone 8.1, you had to flash the Microsoft Manufacturing Operating System (MMOS) to do manufacturing tests and processes, such as test hardware, blow fuses, and provision security keys.

segment.source: Once the tests were completed, you had to flash the full operating system.
segment.target: Once the tests were completed, you had to flash the full operating system.

segment.source: This added extra time on the manufacturing floor.
segment.target: This added extra time on the manufacturing floor.

segment.source: This new feature allows you to boot into a manufacturing mode of the full operating system (and do those manufacturing steps) without having to flash an MMOS image.
segment.target: This new feature allows you to boot into a manufacturing mode of the full operating system (and do those manufacturing steps) without having to flash an MMOS image.

segment.source: Manufacturing profiles
segment.target: Manufacturing profiles

segment.source: A manufacturing profile defines settings that should be used when the operating system boots in manufacturing mode.
segment.target: A manufacturing profile defines settings that should be used when the operating system boots in manufacturing mode.

segment.source: The device can have more than one manufacturing profile.
segment.target: The device can have more than one manufacturing profile.

segment.source: A profile named Default is included with Windows 10 Mobile.
segment.target: A profile named Default is included with Windows 10 Mobile.

segment.source: The default profile contains the settings for Microsoft components that let the device boot into a minimal environment for Manufacturing Mode.
segment.target: The default profile contains the settings for Microsoft components that let the device boot into a minimal environment for Manufacturing Mode.

segment.source: Manufacturing profiles are stored in the registry on the device in the following location:
segment.target: Manufacturing profiles are stored in the registry on the device in the following location:

segment.source: HKEYLOCALMACHINESystemCurrentControlSetControlManufacturingMode You must create a subkey for each manufacturing profile.
segment.target: HKEYLOCALMACHINESystemCurrentControlSetControlManufacturingMode You must create a subkey for each manufacturing profile.

segment.source: Under the profile key, you can change the settings for some select operating system components for when the system is booting in manufacturing mode.
segment.target: Under the profile key, you can change the settings for some select operating system components for when the system is booting in manufacturing mode.

segment.source: For example, you can alter which services are started when this manufacturing profile is enabled.
segment.target: For example, you can alter which services are started when this manufacturing profile is enabled.

segment.source: You can add your own services in the Services subkey, as shown below.
segment.target: You can add your own services in the Services subkey, as shown below.

segment.source: If you want to set all services to the same start type, you can use an for the service name.
segment.target: If you want to set all services to the same start type, you can use an for the service name.

segment.source: If the wildcard is not used, all Win32 services that are not included in the manufacturing profile will use their default start type.
segment.target: If the wildcard is not used, all Win32 services that are not included in the manufacturing profile will use their default start type.

segment.source: Note The wildcard only applies to Win32 services, excluding kernel-mode drivers.
segment.target: Note The wildcard only applies to Win32 services, excluding kernel-mode drivers.

segment.source: The following example creates a manufacturing profile named CustomProfile, causes the service named OEMFactoryTestService to automatically start, and all other Win32 services to demand start:
segment.target: The following example creates a manufacturing profile named CustomProfile, causes the service named OEMFactoryTestService to automatically start, and all other Win32 services to demand start:

segment.source: The manufacturing profile name must be less than 64 characters.
segment.target: The manufacturing profile name must be less than 64 characters.

segment.source: You cannot use Current for the name of your manufacturing profile.
segment.target: You cannot use Current for the name of your manufacturing profile.

segment.source: This name is reserved for the currently active manufacturing profile.
segment.target: This name is reserved for the currently active manufacturing profile.
